revised_title: The Perception of Visual Movement in Toads
tldr: This study investigates the visual perception of movement in toads and how it influences their feeding reactions. The researchers found that toads can recognize stationary objects and even differentiate between their parts. They also discovered that toads have a kinematoscopic sensation of movement, which elicits a snapping reflex and a tongue-flicking reaction. This research contributes to our understanding of how animals perceive and respond to visual stimuli.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Behavior
